column4: hello, i am unable to boot into recovery mode in version 11.10.  i get inode and mountall errors.  does anyone know how to fix?  thanks!!
why do you need recovery mode?
i get the same errors when booting normally.  :(
ok...thats not good
have you checked grub, is it valid?
no.  how should i?
by using a livd cd
mount your root partition (or boot partition, if any)
ok one sec
they are viewable in my GUI, is that ok?
my linux boot partition is mounted according to the gui
ok
are you familiar with the command line?
yes i can use terminal a bit
lol the path does appear to be /media/a42155d3-f02a-422b-82f4-5f15874e6a20$
ok than go to that path
yes
lol, not in years, but i've pico'd it now
can you paste the file contect to pastebin?
http://pastebin.com/8FzEs2X5
does the windowsxp entry still work?
yes, that is the OS she is using now that linux failed
paste the output of     sudo fdisk -l
you still there?  looks like a disco :)
